name: incipiently
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is just beginning to develop: Most of the language varieties were already, incipiently, moving in the same direction. This feature was already incipiently present in the seventeenth-century data.
More examplesFewer examplesEven with an incipiently curvaceous figure, I looked like a boy.You come away with some general impressions which may well be, in certain important respects, incipiently misleading.His writing was inspired by what he saw as incipiently fascist popular culture in the 1950s.
